## Classes

### hyperkube

Sets up the current node as part of a K8s cluster using the hyperkube binary

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `hyperkube` class.

##### `ensure`

Data type: `Enum['present', 'absent']`

Desired state of the hyperkube setup

Default value: 'present'

##### `packaging`

Data type: `Enum['docker','native']`

The packaging to use for running the service

Default value: 'native'

##### `version`

Data type: `String`

The K8s version to install

Default value: '1.8.4'

##### `docker_registry`

Data type: `String`

The Docker registry to read the docker image from when packaging is 'docker'

Default value: 'gcr.io/google_containers'

##### `docker_image`

Data type: `String`

The Docker image to use when packaging is 'docker'

Default value: 'hyperkube'

##### `docker_image_tag`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

The tag for the Docker image when packaging is 'docker' - defaults to v<version>

Default value: "v${version}"

##### `native_url_template`

Data type: `String`

The URL template string to use when downloading the native hyperkube binary
The string is read as a format string following the Ruby #Kernel::sprintf rules, included are a few useful values;
- version - The requested K8s version string
- arch - The system architecture as defined by the os.architecture fact
- optional_arch - A helper for the common naming schema of go binaries, either undef for amd64, or -<ARCH> for all other architectures.

Default value: 'http://storage.googleapis.com/kubernetes-release/release/v%<version>s/bin/linux/amd64/hyperkube%{optional_arch}'

##### `docker_manage_image`

Data type: `Boolean`

Should the module manage the docker image

Default value: `true`

##### `manage_docker`

Data type: `Boolean`

Should the module manage the docker installation

Default value: `true`

##### `role`

Data type: `Optional[Enum['node','control_plane']]`

The role of the current node, if the module is to set up one of the roles

Default value: `undef`

### hyperkube::addons::dns

The hyperkube::addons::dns class.

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet

  ensure       => present,
  dns_domain   => 'cluster.local',
  dns_ip       => '10.2.0.2',
  service_cidr => '10.2.0.0/24',
  provider     => 'coredns',
}
```

#### Examples

```puppet

  $allow_privileged = true,
  $apiserver_count = 2,
  $etcd_servers = [ 'https://1.2.3.4:2379', 'http://127.0.0.1:4001' ],
  $service_cluster_ip_range = '10.0.1.0/24',
}
```

## Defined types

### hyperkube::binary

The hyperkube::binary class.

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `hyperkube::binary` defined type.

##### `version`

Data type: `String`



Default value: $title

##### `ensure`

Data type: `Enum['present','absent']`



Default value: 'present'

##### `native_url_template`

Data type: `String`



Default value: $hyperkube::native_url_template

##### `native_url`

Data type: `Stdlib::HTTPUrl`



Default value: sprintf($native_url_template, {
      arch          => fact('os.architecture'),
      optional_arch => (fact('os.architecture') ? {
          'amd64'   => undef,
          default   => "-${fact('os.architecture')}",
      }),
      version       => $version,
  })

## Data types

### Hyperkube::CIDR

This regexp matches CIDR values

Alias of `Pattern[/^([0-9]{1,3})(\.[0-9]{1,3}){3}\/[0-9]{1,2}$/]`

### Hyperkube::Duration

This regexp matches Go duration values, as taken from;
https://golang.org/pkg/time/#ParseDuration

Alias of `Pattern[/^(-?[0-9]+(\.[0-9]+)?(ns|us|µs|ms|s|m|h))+$/]`

### Hyperkube::PortRange

This regexp matches port range values

Alias of `Pattern[/^[0-9]+(-[0-9]+)?/]`

### Hyperkube::URI

This regexp matches URI values

Alias of `Pattern[/^[a-z]+:\/\//]`
